snippet: As more states legalize casinos, dissipating the power of that lure, the South Dakota town is trying to restyle its history and offerings into a new tourist-friendly package.
abstract: Deadwood, gold rush settlement in the Black Hills of South Dakota brought back to life 25 years ago with legal gambling, is facing competition from casinos in other states and gambling revenue has fallen significantly; effort is underway to restyle town's outlaw history and outdoor recreation into new tourist-friendly destination less reliant on its casinos for a draw.
lead_paragraph: As more states legalize casinos, dissipating the power of that lure, the South Dakota town is trying to restyle its history and offerings into a new tourist-friendly package.

headline.main: As Gold and Gambling Lose Their Luster, Deadwood Seeks a Spark
headline.print_headline: As Gold and Gambling Lose Their Luster, Deadwood Seeks a Spark
